name: 1.12 "The Spy Who Came in for a Cold One" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: What did the man say his name was when he met Carla?
questions.explanation:
Eric Finch.

	Eric Finch was played by Ellis Rabb. Rabb was born in 1930 and died in 1998. Rabb inspired Kelsey Grammar's character Sideshow Bob on "The Simpsons".

questions.text: What did Cliff say was "the smartest animal"?
questions.explanation:
Pig.

	Cliff said that it was a scientific fact that pigs are the smartest animals. He said that a pig could do manual labour if they had thumbs.

questions.text: What did Norm say was the smartest animal?
questions.explanation:
ants.

	Norm believed the ant to be the smartest animal because of how they organize their colonies. He figured for its size especially they did a lot of complicated things.

questions.text: What did Carla think the man was?
questions.explanation:
a spy.

	Eric told Carla these stories about being a spy. Diane corrected him so Carla found out he was not a spy.

questions.text: Why did Sam say people came to bars?
questions.correct: "to shoot off their mouths and have people listen"
options: "to play trivia games, pool, or darts"
questions.explanation:
"to shoot off their mouths and have people listen".

	Sam told Diane this when she said the man wasn't really a spy. Everyone else seemed to be enjoying Eric's stories, everybody except Diane.

questions.text: Who thought the man was a liar?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	Diane was upset by the man's stories. Sam told her that it was normal for men in bars to tell tall tales.

questions.text: What did Coach say when someone made a mental error?
options: He explained the facts of life to them.
questions.explanation:
Nothing.

	Coach said he said nothing which was why he got fired as a coach. Coach was a very simple man in his ways of thinking but loved by all.

questions.text: What did the man say he was when he came back?
questions.explanation:
writer.

	This time it was Diane that fell for his lie. She thought he was a brilliant writer but found out he didn't write his own stuff at all.

questions.text: What did Diane tell the man she majored in?
questions.explanation:
poetry.

	Diane had at least 80 majors during her college career. She majored in psychology as well at some point, and pre-law, but what she told the man she majored in was poetry.

questions.text: When the man recited a poem, who recited it with him?
questions.explanation:
Coach.

	Diane thought that the poem was the most amazing poem she ever heard. She wanted the man to get published until Coach joined in reciting the poem. Then Diane felt foolish for falling for another lie this man told.
